Reviews.Title: “wont happen again”
Reviews.Author: sumguy
Reviews.Content: booked our 4-night stay through Montreal Tourism website, sweat deal offer (50% off every second night). Entered 2 adults and 2 kids, and the rates displayed, and the order the rates were displayed, and the remark on the website all happening only with that specific hotel on the website lead me to expect different rates than what the hotel told me at check-in. After long conversations with Tourism Montreal and the Hotel, no one was able to explain why the site did that and displayed different numbers than what the hotel received, and in a different order. I had a choice of go somewhere else or take the hotel's manager offer which ended up higher than what I expected. What disappointed me even more was that I realized later that what the manager gave me and called a discount was actually another correction since the site gave me a 4-adults rate instead 2, but she insisted she would base the 50% off of the rate before the $20 discount as some kind of "count your blessings". Later I figured out the fact that the $20 was actually a correction, and then what she did was simply taking advantage of me not knowing that and charged me $10 more on the discounted nights. Now $10 is not much and am not fussing about them, but it only showed me a dishonest move from a manager of a big name hotel, and for how much? $10? off a 4 night stay of almost $500 in total ? Escalated issue to head office, and later got the message clear saying it is a franchise business and head office has no control whatsoever on rates. Aside from that : Pros: - location close to airport bus route - breakfast was good Cons: - Hot water tank in the bedroom closet made loud noise every time someone was using the bathroom, and that was very annoying at night. Reception told me all units have the same problem. - Mattress felt like a cheapo coiled one. A slight move on one side of the bed shakes the whole bed. I thought they stopped making those $200 ones anymore. (or at least it felt like one of them). Overall: well, never again

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!! Excellent Place for Groups...”
Reviews.Author: StefSparks
Reviews.Content: I checked in to this hotel after the Easter weekend. I paid less than $70/night on Hotwire and was give a 1 BR suite. I didn't have the problem others did of being put in a smoking room. Further, the young man at the reception desk was exceedingly nice. PROS: -Great price through Hotwire and probably through other sites also -Large room with flat screen TV -Friendly staff, gentleman at check-in was exceedingly friendly and the lady at check-out mailed by post-cards for me -Free breakfast -Very close to Chinatown and the the Metro -Airport Express bus stops right outside the hotel -Kitchenette and separate living room (got a suite for $70/night)... would've been great for a group -Free business center so you can print/check e-mail -Free wifi in room w/ a decent signal -Only a couple of metro stops from major tourist attractions CONS -Hotel is a little old, but does not dip below three star quality -My toilet was EXTREMELY noisy -Might not feel like a great deal at a very high nightly rate

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Brettsky72
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when we came up to have a good time in college and recently came back for business at UQAM. It is a great value, free breakfast and big rooms. We liked it in college as well due to location to fun spots, parking for $18 a day, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for a family”
Reviews.Author: Jim F
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family - kids are 18 and 20 so picky - and it was great. Alive for the price. The decor is budget basic but it's clean, safe, priced right and the breakfast saved us over $200 for the trip. Staff was wonderful. Perfect area right near Chinatown, Old Montreal and St Denis for food and clubs. Recommend if you want great spot on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jess_a828
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and was very happy with it. It was a little outside of the city centre, but I didn't mind the walk and found that the free breakfasts made it well worth it. I typically prefer suite-style hotels when I'm travelling for a few days and definitely made use of the fridge, microwave, and kettle. There was even a dishwasher, but I didn't find it necessary. The staff were all incredibly friendly and helpful. My one complaint would be the internet connection, which was not very strong or reliable. I found that the wireless was much better though, so it wasn't really an issue. Overall, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.. or sometimes a little less!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica L
Reviews.Content: Stayed here September 2011, was in Montreal with a friend for 3 days of shopping and partying. This hotel was an average priced hotel, I knew what to expect as I read reviews before booking.. It is out dated and a bit dirty looking. Would have been happier if I paid a bit less though. The kitchenette was nice, with a separate room for the bed, but the couch looked like it was from the 90's and had lots of random stains. There was only 2 of each utensil in the cupboard, and no dish soap - so if you plan on using the dishes, bring soap. The breakfast buffet was small and not too much there unless you like cereal, toast, yogurt and fruit - which was fine for us. The location is good - depending on where you are going. It is a close walk to Old Montreal and right next to China Town. To get to the shopping though, is about 15-20 minute walk, and same with most of the bars. Plus, the airport bus stops almost right in front of the hotel. I would say if you don't care much about what the hotel looks like and just want somewhere cheap and fairly close to everything, this is a decent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: pradipd25
Reviews.Content: My hotel reviews are based upon value for money i.e. whether we received value for what we paid. Otherwise it is impossible and unfair to compare a Motel 6 with a Holiday Inn with an Intercontinental with a Banyan Tree Resort. For the same hotel, 2 people may have paid different amounts and therefore may have different value judgments. I paid $60 per nite for this Holiday Inn, and at this price this is very good value, specially since I got upgraded to a huge one bedroom suite and with fast wifi and a view od snow falling alla round me. It was very good value in spite of the fact that the room and the hotel itself appears very dated and is in desperate need of overhaul. Threre was a decades old boxy TV in both the rooms, the bathroom and kitchen fixtures made all sorts of noises when used, the carper seemed old and worn. And of course the typical Holiday Inn breakfast is inedible consisting of factory produced, industrial quality processed items that are both unhealthy and inedible and a major cause of cancer, diabetes and other life style diseases in North America. Only the coffee was excellent, but one cannot have coffee by itself on an empty stomach. Parking is very steep at $20 per day, but a big boon on this snowy day. Location is great and ona good day it is walking distance to many places, and is a 5 minute walk to the underground city.

Reviews.Title: “Way below average”
Reviews.Author: Melanie P
Reviews.Content: I have booked a room through Hotwire over the past weekend. Â I was happy to get a room for $80 including tax at a Holiday Inn Express since I had stayed at Dorval, HIE a few week prior and was really impressed with the place. Â When we arrived, we were greeted by a less than friendly staff that told us that, because we had reserved through Hotwire and because the hotel was fully booked for that night, we would get a smoking room. Â I was not too happy about it but I guess we had no choice since we had already paid for the room and could not get a refund. Â When we got into the room, I could not believe how "filthy" it was. Â There were spots on the wall (which I cleaned myself), spots on the unidentifiable color carpet that looked like gum spots. Â One of the curtain was torn and there were spots on the sofa chair. Â The floor and the chair seemed to have not been washed in ages. Â The bed was badly made upâ€¦ Â And, finally, I am not talking about the smell in the room. Â There was no way we would stay in that room for any price. Â We decided just to leave, not spend the night there and get a room somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Best Holiday Inn in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: MohamadMoe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel this week for a few nights and it was great. David the Sales Manager at the hotel went above and beyond to make sure my stay went well. I highly recommend Holiday Inn Express over any other holiday inn's downtown Montreal. I use to stay all the time at another Holiday Inn property with close to 500 rooms located downtown and i will never stay there again. The rooms are huge and clean. Breakfast is wonderful and staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Just average...”
Reviews.Author: whileitravel
Reviews.Content: Needs a renovation. antiquated rooms. good location. Decent price. Wouldnt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Was good 5 years ago but....”
Reviews.Author: marco47
Reviews.Content: Checked in last night, am supposed to stay till this Friday. For $20 bucks a night, you are asked to squeeze your car into a parking garage under construction, barely 1 lane wide. Then tonight, I come back from work, jump in the shower, and when getting out here a door card swipe, and 2 ladies come walking in who were given a card for my room!! What if this had happened while I am not here?? Front desk guy says ""well, 2 ladies, not bad eh"?? Room is dirty, probably the least of my worries right now. I travel on business a lot, and had decided to give Holiday Inn another chance, and this is what I get.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and very good service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: Francois B
Reviews.Content: I always stay here for business, and it is a good location, the hotel is a little bit old but clean ,I dont think a new counter top in the bath room will change the way I sleep , the beds are comfortable, the staff is very friendly and courtious, Sales Manager David will do what whatever it takes to make your stay more enjoyable.I have stayed in 5 star hotels before for business and got half the service this hotal can give some of these hotel charge up to $200.00 a night, not worth the money. This hotel does not have a bar and it dosent need one as there are tons and tons of bars and restaurants in Mtl and im sure that you will have more fun in a regular bar/restaurant then the bar at Days Inn! A huge bunch of great restaurants within 15 min walk.Food in Montreal is great!Ii love comming here

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Lemo D
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel for 1 night, the guy at the reception was really helpful and kind. The reservation department made a mistake on my last name, and I made a mistake not written down the confirmation number, which lead the guy on the front desk not to see my reservation, I had an option to make a new reservation on the front desk, but the guy didnt want me to get doubled charged, and he wanted to make sure to solve the problem, which at the end it turned out that the reservation department made a mistake spelling my last name. Gave me my room number, internet access code, and asked me if I need anything else he will be glad to help. (good service attitude) OK now I reached my floor. there was some odd smell on the floor as soon as I entered, however once I'm in my room everything was normal and no odd smell. the room was OK nothing above average, but comparing to the price I paid I would say its above average value. And the pictures on their website is somehow old and its not exactly as how it is, the moment I checked in. (probably way way outdated) as of now I would recommend it to someone who looks for the best value he cant get under $130 a night in a suite room, kitchen and willing to pass the con's I mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: ajhorse21
Reviews.Content: Crucial info: The Days Inn the next block over has a bar. This one doesn't. That aside, the relatively inexpensive and massive suites easily and comfortably sleep four people (for no additional charge!) with the pullout sofa. Our showerhead dripped, and the televisions are the old-fashioned tube variety, but the beds were comfortable enough. Oh, and there was weirdly one day when they didn't come to clean. The free continental breakfast was exciting every day though, with fresh cinnamon rolls, apples and bananas, English muffins, bagel, bread, oatmeal, four varieties of cereal, a pancake-making conveyer belt, yogurt, hard-boiled eggs, bacon or sausage, plus some egg dish (scrambled or omelettes--beware that they may have meat though!). Free wifi in the rooms, a fitness facility we didn't get a chance to check out. We were there for a convention at the Palais de Congres, and the walk was easy and quick. The 747 bus takes you to and from the airport, but make sure you're paying attention to the stops, or you may end up at the terminus in the dark of night, sad and alone in Montreal. In other news, a cab will cost $38. Oh, and there's no room service. You do have to venture from your bed to be fed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: namesalreadyused
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated in the downtown area and was close to the Palais des Congress. The staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful. The room was spacious with a neat kitchen and desk. Traffic noise was not a problem as windows had double glazing. I also did not detect the sttrong smoke smell other reviewers complained about in the non-smoking room. There was a hint of smokiness in the passage. The complimentary wireless internet access was slow at peak times. The complimentary breakfast were nice apart from the wafer-thin bacon which was done a touch too crispy, and I like crispy bacon.

Reviews.Title: “Economy hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: charoos
Reviews.Content: HIE Montreal is ideally located for tourists, traveling to enjoy the history and culture of the modern french city in Canada. It is walking distance to Notre Dame, a classic beautiful cathedral, famous for its interiors, and the sound and light show every evening. The city centre, the pier, the China Town and the lanes full of shops for exotic souvenirs, are all close-by. Nearby Metro station provides convenient and economical connectivity to other parts of the city, including the Olympic Village, botanical garden and aviary, all of which are must-sees. The airport bus stop is right outside the hotel. The hotel provides complementary hot buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a budget hotel - very nice breakfasts! Very helpful staff too.”
Reviews.Author: deep_mental
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked and paid for me for a conference. Most other hotels were full. After reading the other reviews on TripAdvisor, I was a little apprehensive about it but found it a comfortable and a nice room to come back to relax after a busy day. The hotel was close by to the Convention Center where I had to go everyday, about 10-15 minutes walk. Breakfast was very nice and there is plenty of it. The dining area is small so try to get there early. The room is quite noisy, even after I switched off the air conditioning, which I find a problem. As the heading said the staff were very helpful, they gave me a free map for where I needed to go, and booked my taxi back to the airport, also keeping my bags after checkout when I wanted to go out for the day. Unfortunatley, because of the noise, I wouldn't go back or bring my family unless they had sorted that out. I also agree that I didn't hang around there at night (I was travelling about mostly alone), just brought my take-away dinner to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Masuyb
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel at walking distance from downtown shops( St Catherine) and with easy access from the airport by the express bus 747 (Stops in front of the hotel). The standart room that we booked was equipped with a little kitchen and a TV/dressing room. The Wifi is free and the breakfast is good. The staff is very friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: Deb9088
Reviews.Content: 7 non speaking french went to Montreal and had a blast- couldn't have happened without the Hotels Guidence and Help - They we so helpful ! Brunch was great - only complaint was fridge didn't work and called the repair man and he could have cared less - We had SNOW in the balcany so all was good.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: lilopty
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Montreal this past May and stayed at the Holiday Inn Express. We did our hotel reservations last minute so it was one of the only affordable hotels left in the area. Its walking distance to many places, but the block where the hotel is situated is kind of sketchy. It was scary to walk during the night but nothing happen to us while we were there. First night they gave us a smoking room because it was the only thing they had left. It was the worst room I have ever been in my life. The smell was so strong you couldn't sleep. The whole smoking floor smells horrible. We were able to change rooms the next day. The rooms are pretty big but it doesn't look that clean and they are outdated.

Reviews.Title: “In desperate need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: primitivepios
Reviews.Content: As previously mentioned, this hotel's location is very hard to beat. It is close both to the historic center of the city and the downtown area, very close to the Latin Quarter. Unfortunately, this is where it all ends. Rooms are very spacious but terribly old, the entire room is litteraly falling apart. And of course, when it si so old, it is also very dirty. Service is nice, but it doesn't make up for the terrible condition of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: C-and-RS
Reviews.Content: In Montreal on business with a colleague, this seemed like a good option. When we arrived, we ran in to the following problems: 1. We had been guaranteed a two bed room over the phone; only one bed. 2. The second bed was a sofa-bed: it was broken... Moved to another room... 3. The carpet had not been vacuumed (or very poorly so) 4. The wireless internet was down (they did fix it some hours after we arrived though) 5. The hotel is run-down, shabby, in need of renovations and serious cleaning The staff was friendly a tried to be helpful despite the conditions of the hotel. There are many other options within the same price range that are not as bad. Other colleagues stayed in other hotels and B&Bs around town, also within walking distance of the conference centre and major attractions, with similar prices and far better quality. I will definitely not stay there again nor do I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: adftom
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for three nights in September. The hotel is centrally located and convenient to Old Montreal, UQAM, etc. They gave us a small suite which was comfortably furnished and which had a small balcony. The room was quite satisfactory and the kitchen was a bonus. The breakfast area was a little small for the size of the hotel, but it didn't really cause us any problems. The area seemed quite safe to us - there were some homeless people around, but it's a big city, after all. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: juliee1906
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights in September, 2011. I'm used to the quality one gets at a decent Best Western. This facility was a bit dirty and in need of updating. By dirty, I mean the walls and carpeting - the bathroom was spotless. My biggest disappointment was that I was not given a non-smoking room even though it was requested far in advance, so the room smelled. To guarantee a non-smoking room, you had to pay double! It was also noisy in the hallway as our room was directly across from the maids locker room. They also smoked in the hallway adding to the stench. On the positive side: The breakfast was above average for this type of place, with hot mini omelettes and breakfast meat as well as all the normal cold things. The location was pretty good as well - on a main street near old Montreal and 3 blocks from a metro station. It was 1/2 block from the 747 Express bus to the airport - very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for a vacation, but hotel is a bit outdated”
Reviews.Author: acat800
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews here are accurate. The hotel is very well located within walking distance to Chinatown, shopping districts, old Montreal and many restaraunts. I've stayed here twice for buisiness because of the great location. I don't think it's in a dangerous location, you may find homeless people anywhere in Montreal and I've never had (and never witnessed anyone else) have a problem with them. The bad is that it is outdated. The wireless access in the hotel too slow to be useful, the carpets in some of the rooms have seen better days, the showers seem to smell a bit musty and if you park in the garage you may smell a stong stench of garbage (seems this is where the garbage for the rooms ends up). Both of the rooms I was given were spacious suites with kitchen and living areas. (although one of them was odd shaped so the beds were located in the living area and where the bedroom should be was a makeshift office with a closet). The breakfast area does seem to get too crowded on the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Not Holiday Inn Standards”
Reviews.Author: Lautenberg
Reviews.Content: I had two nights at Montreal and decided to stay at the Holiday Inn due to my priority program. This hotel did not matched the normal Holiday Inn standards. For me the most important think is hygiene and the room and the breakfast room was not clean, from towels and sheets to chairs and tables.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: fireball36
Reviews.Content: We had planned on staying only one night, but we stayed for three. This hotel was the perfect location for a couple wanting to be close to historical downtown Montreal. Everything was within walking distance...fantastic restaurants, shopping, historical architecture. Also a short walk to the subway station. Parking was only $18 a day...so we left the vehicle there and walked or took the subway everywhere. The staff were extremely friendly; always with a huge smile and spoke very good English. We had a large one-bedroom suite, which was very clean and comfortable. We would definitely stay at this hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Kestral120
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Candlewood Suites next door. However the $20 per day difference is worth every penny. The difference between the two hotels is remarkable. The Holiday Inn rooms are fresh and they don't smell of cigarette smoke like the Candlewood. The service at the Holiday Inn is with wide smiles. Not as wide at the Candlewood. The only down side to the Holiday Inn was the temp control in the room. It dis not work well. And we were too preoccupied to make that service call. Will definately stay there in future.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: paolamz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located quite centrally, walking distance to the Old Port, Old Town and the Latin Quarter (restaurants). Very close to the bus stop to/from the airport (bus 747, 8 $)! It's not really new but well mantained, clean, confortable, with spacious room (kitchen, living room and bedroom!) and big bathroom. The staff at the reception is kind and helpful. Free Wi-fi for guests. The only thing to improve is breakfast: medium quality, poor assortment, too many people waiting in line to approach the buffet and to find a table to sit down. I would definetely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Average Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Kr3m3Puff
Reviews.Content: The location, for downtown Montreal, is right between St. Denis/UQAM and McGill. The breakfast area is undersized for the amount of rooms they have, often leading it to be overrun in the mornings (though this is typical of most Holiday Inn Expresses). The staff are somewhat friendly, but like the rest of the hotel are seem to feel a bit dated and tired. Personally, I find it offensive to have to wait behind staff to get morning breakfast and was generally annoyed by the cleaning staff taking the lifts during the busy morning periods to go up or down one floor and holding the lift doors open waiting for their co-worker to come. It seems we patrons we simply minor annoyances in them getting their job done.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Chris C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a run down neighborhood - wouldn't feel too safe at night. Room a bit shabby - flying insects buzzing around...... Maybe this is what you get for that kind of money in a big city, but if you're looking for a nice hotel, keep looking......

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: jsk567
Reviews.Content: good location to walk to Vieux Port - very easy through China Town. I had read other reviews that this hotel was near the "seedy" section of town which was quite accurate. I was uncomfortable walking towards rue Ste. Catherine after making a right turn from the hotel. I was also uncomfortable with people loitering outside the hotel asking hotel guests for money. Overall, a clean hotel (could use some updating), spacious rooms, friendly staff and a good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressive due to ridiculously loud air conditioning unit”
Reviews.Author: wearyn0mad
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed here for a few nights. Our first problem arose at check-in - no parking was available despite being requested at time of booking. We were advised to try a few other parking stations in the area, 0.5-1km away. [We ended up parking at the Grand Bibliotheque on Rue Berri - note that if you pay $9 for 24 hrs parking during the weekend, the machines will in error only print a ticket for 12 hours. You will need to bring your ticket to the attendant so they can change this by hand.] The room was a 1 BR queen suite. It seemed run-down with lots of scuff marks on the walls. The living area and room were a decent size. We were located fairly far from the elevator, which meant that noise was thankfully not an issue. Kitchenette had the basics, though no coffee cups (we were told to come to reception and get them for ourselves; only plastic cups were available). Breakfast was average and the dining room was small for a hotel of this size - at peak times there were queues heading into the lobby area. The location was convenient to Chinatown, the Old Port and the Latin Quarter, though be aware that at night Rene Levesque Blvd seems a little unsafe. Our major problem was the air conditioning unit which was located in the bedroom - it was insanely loud. I measured it at 60 decibels from the location of the nearest sleeper's pillow, approx 5 feet away from the unit. (For comparison, this is about the same volume as a normal conversation from 3 feet away, or an average air conditioning unit from 20 feet away.) Turning it off altogether resulted in a very stuffy room, even with the air recirculating from the living area. I ended up sleeping on the living room sofa.

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget suite with great breakfast included”
Reviews.Author: skimarie
Reviews.Content: Visiting Rogers Cup tennis at Uniprix Stadium, Montreal. Good location for Metro (Champs de Mars). Parking in Montreal is a nightmare so just paid $18 per day to leave car in hotel's underground parking and used Metro for four days we were there. Clean, decent accommodation - a bit drab- but everything worked and effective air conditioning. Old style TV. Recommend if you plan to be out and about not spending much time in the hotel. Excellent breakfast buffet including eggs, bacon and/or sausage.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: northropfrye
Reviews.Content: We stayed four people in a suite, and it was okay. The place could use an update, but at least it was clean. The location is on a boring street, but not too far from the tourist area. The price was quite expensive, so it doesn't represent good value for what you get, but it's an average acceptable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor facility”
Reviews.Author: R D
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in a two bedroom suite, VERY disappointed with the rooms. Carpet had frayed edges at kitchen area, major water markes on baseboards, lower cupboards damaged, walls dirty, mold on grout in bathtub,curtains dirty and ripped. Overall appearance of hotel dirty and unkept. Bedroom a/c fan so loud couldn't be run. One of two elevators broken down.

Reviews.Title: “O.K. stay but wouldn't recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: DLC99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights at a price of $179 per night. We try not to be too critical of minor problems but there were too many things in this hotel that were poor quality. Walls and doors that are visibly marked or dirty throughout the hotel and in the rooms, visible stains on the carpets, bathroom tub with mildew and missing caulking and bathroom tiled floor cracked and visibly marked. The location to Old Montreal and the downtown shopping area is great (15-20 minute walking distance) but the area has many boarded up buildings and a lot of people living on the street/panhandling. To be fair, the room was generally clean and the beds were comfortable. The staff was excellent. Our stay at the hotel was O.K. but I wouldn't recommend it to my family or friends which is why I rate the hotel as poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, location and good breakfast"”
Reviews.Author: deuxcentimes
Reviews.Content: I brought a group of 18 here on June 15th and we had a great time. The hotel was clean, centrally located between Chinatown/Old Montreal and Rue St. Catherine so it was easy to get to and easy to get around town from it. The staff was friendly and the breakfast was varied and fresh. We appreciated the hot coffee that was available in the evening as well. My only warning would be to get to breakfast early as there is limited seating and a large group will swamp the facility.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - tired facility”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelling2011
Reviews.Content: My family and I usually like Holiday Inn's; however, this one did not meet the usual Holiday Inn quality in several aspects: 1. The grout around the tub was not complete. It was wearing away; 2. The bed mattresses were very old and hard; 3. The TV was a very old model; 4. The carpet near the kitchen linoleum was lifting up and missing some parts; 5. The main entrance light near the large closet was burned out; 6. The closet had a dirty cup in it left from a previous occupant; 7. The toilet rocked slightly when one sat on it; 8. The toilet roll was partially disconnected from the wall and it wobbled when one took paper off of it; 9. The 4th and 8th floor ice machines were not working and the desk clerk sent us to the 5th floor where there was no ice machine; 10. The hotel has 4 elevator shafts, but only 2 were working. It was hard to get into an elevator that was not full. Only 1 of the elevators went to the basement parking lot; 11. The parking lot was full of grit because it had not been swept out since the winter weather (this was July); 12. The parking lot was very dark and had many dark corners. We did not feel safe in the underground parking lot; 13. The breakfast part was not pleasant. The food was the usual Holiday Inn fare and was good. However, the masses of school children flooding the breakfast area at the same time as the other guests meant the seating was inadequate to support this large Holiday Inn. The one good aspect of our experience was the staff - front desk and cleaning staff. We would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Good location.”
Reviews.Author: mantas99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here recently during a trip to Montreal. We weren't expecting much from the hotel, but were pleasantly surprised. The room was set up more like a small apartment. The bedroom was separate from a small living room and kitchen area. The kitchen had a full fridge, microwave and dishwasher. The only thing it was missing was a stovetop and oven (which I'm sure was for liability reasons). The location was good...easy to get wherever we wanted. We could walk to Chinatown and down to the port area. The room was very clean, and the front desk staff were very helpful. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay with good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: XTWO
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not centrally located but still within respectable walking distance to attractions. Our room was clean and comfortable, the bathroom was spacious and the kitchenette useful. There was a water patch on the carpet (possibly from a leaky pipe?) but the housekeeping staff did what they could to correct this. There was no wifi but the internet connection was good. Strangely there is only one operating set of lifts and as our room was on the other side of the hotel we had to walk to the other side of the floor to get to it. Breakfast is included and has a great selection of options, but it can get quite busy during the breakfast period (there was a school group staying in the hotel during our stay). Overall a decent stay in a decent location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but hotel felt really worn out and tired”
Reviews.Author: bills_pix
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms here recently and while the location is excellent, the hotel is several years past due for a renovation. Door frames are chipped, hallways dark, and the bathrooms just feel worn out. We have stayed at many Holiday Inn Express hotels in the US and Europe and this one is in the worst shape of any of them. The breakfast area was great but just swamped with people. A real challenge to find a table for 3. Worst of all, was it was impossible to figure out how to set the room temperature and our request on the first day to stop the rattling air conditioner was ignored. It was a real annoyance.

Reviews.Title: “Close to old city & right on airport bus line”
Reviews.Author: TeacherProf
Reviews.Content: Rooms in this Holiday Inn Express are large - it's actually a mini-apartment, with a living room area, kitchen, and bedroom (plus bath). We only stayed one night and didn't need all that, but wow, one could even do meals if desired. Breakfast includes a lot of variety and hot items. There is a business center that we used to check in for our flights; there is also free wireless in rooms. Staff was friendly and helpful. Location is pretty good. It's a short walk to the old city, though the several blocks between the hotel and old city (via Chinatown) were a little scrungy and we only did them in daylight. It's on a major street, and the the airport express bus (#747) stops just a block away (great way to/from the airport, by the way). A Metro line is not far either, and the airport bus ticket includs a 24 hour transit pass. We would likely stay here again if in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor facilities but good service”
Reviews.Author: rachail
Reviews.Content: I flew in for the Canadian Chemical Society Meeting held June 5-8. This hotel was selected for me by the Conference Hotel Reservation Center. I selected a standard room. When I arrived I was told that even though I selected a standard non-smoking room, there were none available so I had to accept a smoking room. The room of course smelled. I went to set up my computer on the Table/Desk provided. The electricity was out in this end of the room. So I had to move my computer to a coffee table far from a wall socket that worked. The room was decrepit as the carpet was worn, all the fixtures old. The breakfast that was included ...also included so many guests that I had to take my food to my room to eat it. Finally, although they supplied free internet...the bandwidth was so small that in fact, it only worked before 7 and after 11 pm...so it was practically useless

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: nomader13
Reviews.Content: The location is wonderful... couldn't say more about it, especially since the price is reasonable... within walking distance of everything! Nice, self-serve breakfast buffet and very helpful staff. 24/7 coffee, tea, hot chocolate Would definitely choose this hotel again...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: raura
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on PC award points. Easy to book online. The hotel is a converted apartment block. Whilst no frills, it is modern and has everything you need including 24hr laundry, gym, complimentary breakfast and complimentary wifi. The airport bus (747) goes right past the door, and it is close for both the old town and latin quarter. Decor is good, good cable TV with both English and French channels. Staff speak both as well. All in all a great place for the price and availability. Very comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: duckworths5
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for it's location. I wanted to be able to walk & not be bothered with taxi's. The location is perfect! The hotel itself is clean & no frills. The staff was very helpful. Always making suggestions, maping locations & willing to make dinner reservations. There is an $8 (each way) bus to the airport. The pick up and drop off stops are a quick 2 minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and not well maintained.”
Reviews.Author: Heatherlou23
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a converted apartment building. It had dirt in the corners, a pod light was falling out, the paint in the bathroom was peeling and the shower head got water everywhere. The room I stayed in had the bedroom separate from the living area. The air conditioner was in the window if the main room and didn't cool the bedroom at all. On the flipside, the breakfast was good and the staff was very friendly

Reviews.Title: “No frills but exactly what we needed and we'd return.”
Reviews.Author: argus23
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel after much seeking on the internet. Pleasant surprise on entering our room - separate bedroom and lounge/kitchen with 2 TV's. We were very comfortable here and location was within walking distance of the CBD, supermarket and the Old City. We found the staff helpful -even though they were under pressure at times. Included breakfast was great, but crowded. Had trouble with WiFi on our fist visit, but when we returned from Quebec 4 days later for a further 3 nights the problem was fixed, as promised. A problem with a charge to our credit card (picked up on return to Australia) was actioned within 24 hrs.

Reviews.Title: “Great all round spot!”
Reviews.Author: schoggigirl
Reviews.Content: I had 3 rooms booked here for a conference, 6 of us in total, and we all enjoyed the hotel for many reasons: 1. Location: 4 blocks from the palais de congres main entrance, 2 blocks from a grocery store and Chinatown, and very easy walk to all the shopping and other restaurants or to the old town. 2. Spacious rooms with full fridges, microwaves, and seating 3. Great breakfast (though the breaker blew a few times since there were a hundred people at the same time for breakfast, but they usually got it back up and running quite quickly), which featured eggs, some bacon or sausage, toast and bagels, cereal, but best of all a pancake machine! Yes, that's right, a machine where you just push a button and 60 seconds later 2 perfectly cooked pancakes popped out the end. Fabulous, its just a shame they don't have real maple syrup but since we were there for a week we just bought some at the IGA 2 blocks away and brought it to breakfast with us. 4. Free wireless internet. Though it was a rough start, they installed it just the day we arrived, within 2 days it was pretty well working. Some people found it patchy in their rooms, but mine was fine. 5. Gym: it was not so big but big enough to get us through a week. All in all it was the right spot at the right price (well we did reserve 8 months in advance so we saved $40 per night per room).

Reviews.Title: “had no problems, friendly helpful staff, decent location”
Reviews.Author: hawksfansince1976
Reviews.Content: I had a good/ok experience, staff was friendly and helpful upon check in and out, breakfast was what you would expect and very busy, room was normal and it was clean, no complaints really and nothing exceptional either.It was alright. Weight room needed some work.It is in a good walking location and convenient to many restaurants, pubs, shops.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: LKJUk
Reviews.Content: Positives: The room was large and reasonably clean, with two large beds. Staff were friendly and helpful. Negatives: The non-smoking room smelled of smoke. The internet was unforgiveably slow. I had to upload some documents and what should have taken a few minutes took 3 hours. I couldn't use Skype at all. The fridge was so loud that I had to turn it off at night. Conclusion: Furniture and equipment are old and tired. Not recommended for the price (over $300 per night)

Reviews.Title: “Seniors 11' are crazy!”
Reviews.Author: brybread1
Reviews.Content: Overall, I have no regrets about choosing the Holiday Inn Express as the hotel for my group. However, there were many problems that I ran into on my trip. First off, the cleaning ladies were aggressive, any time that we declined their service they would begin to argue and eventually they would end up cleaning the room after objection. A major obstacle in communicating with them was the fact that they did not speak a word of English aside from the words "you need towel". Another problem that I encountered was that the internet connection was plug in, not wifi and it was painfully slow. My final obstacle was that none of the 3 rooms which my friends had rented out, had a working bathroom lock which was not a huge problem but it was definitely noteworthy. Aside from these two problems, my experience at the hotel were positive. The location was ideal and it seemed like almost everything was within walking distance. My group was loud and it was never a problem until the last night, when we were asked to quiet down by hotel managers. Also every room has a kitchen of good size which contains a refrigerator, freezer and microwave.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: bajabusdriwer
Reviews.Content: For business I was pretty happy. Big room with big kitchen. Not fancy but totally functional. I thought I had booked into the bad part of town as there's peeler bars and other seedy places within a block but I now realize that's just Montreal. Breakfast was very decent too and staff were friendly. My only complaint was the internet is not WiFi and it was frustratingly slow.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't gross me out, but wouldn't strongly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Maggie G
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights at the end of March. The rooms were large (two queen beds, kitchenette, study, large bathroom), but were outdated. The beds and bathroom seemed clean enough, but there were stains in the carpet and scuff marks on the walls, which made me wonder about what I wasn't seeing. The price was reasonable, breakfast was satisfactory, staff was friendly, and location was very convenient to the Palais de Congres. The internet was a bit of a disappointment as I was sharing the room and had to take turns using the ethernet cord. The internet was slow! If I am in Montreal again, I will spend another $30/night for a nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “A good deal in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: GinaBe58
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and somewhat spacious with a kitchenette. Breakfast is included. Location is the key: a few minutes away from all the downtown attractions and the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you like people giving your room key to strangers & all night parties”
Reviews.Author: TripTrip83
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awful. I stayed for 4 night for business. Despite being "non-smoking" our room and the hallway always reeked of cigarette smoke, as if someone was either smoking right outside our door, in the stairwell, or in the room underneath us. It got worse in the afternoon/evenings, so, it was active smoking rather than a stale left-over smell. I was there on business - but everyone around us was there to party. People were screaming, slamming doors, and talking loudly on their phones at 4am every night. There is no internet in the rooms, despite what the website and confirmation email say. It's hard to conduct business with no internet and I feel the website & confirmation email totally lied. I never would have booked a hotel without reliable internet. Our trash bin had the word "f*gg*t" written on it in large black Sharpie letters (it's so insulting, trip advisor wouldn't let me actually write the word). Worst of all - the front desk gave a key to our room to a total stranger! Thankfully, we were in the room! Can you imagine if we weren't??!?! Our passports and laptops were in there! I have no idea what the hell they were thinking giving a key to a person that was no on our reservation, that we did not know, without ever checking an ID. I feel like that should be illegal...

Reviews.Title: “pretty bad”
Reviews.Author: eschmerin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is mediocre. The restaurant is ok, the rooms are small and not that nice (plastic cups for your water)-- for the price and compared to other hotels in the area it does not seem like a good value. The internet also does not work. They advertise free internet but it's terrible. they said they were trying to fix it but they might tell that to everyone every time this happens. I had depended on having internet to communicate with colleagues, checking into my flight etc. Massive fail on account of internet.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for what it is - despite the St Patrick kids!”
Reviews.Author: DominicB
Reviews.Content: I was also spending four nights here, overlapping with the kids from another province coming on a binge. They were a pain, but in my generously proportioned suite (a mere $5 more per night than a regular room) I could not hear them. I think the location is fine.... Ten mins walk from the very centre of Downtown, on the edge of Chinatown (literally), and no more than ten mins to Vieux Montreal. For little more than $100 per night I had a very roomy suite, with free internet as well. At this price it is very good value.

Reviews.Title: “St Patty's Day Nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: Dieselkali
Reviews.Content: Checked in to find about 50 teenage kids had been booked for a few days of binge drinking ! We were told not to worry as we were on the "corporate floor",a joke that was ! Rooms on either side were partying before and after the bars closed, it was worst at night, 0300 or so! Staff I think did try to keep it under control but were seriously out numbered on all floors! I know for sure I would never under any circumstances book there again! The area is undesirable, rooms are tired and dingy, even on a good night, it would be noisy! Don't go there !

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the right price”
Reviews.Author: beach4me42
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location for walking to everything we wanted to see. The staff was friendly. The lobby and common areas were good. Breakfast was more than the usual continental so thought that was very good. The rooms are quite tired... Furniture is a little old and dirty looking. Rooms could use a painting. However we payed only $85 dollars/ night so very economical. There was a party on our floor the last night. Call to complain and they sent someone up around midnight and it got somewhat quieter but was woken again at 4:30 with them yelling and drinking in the hallway, so not much sleep that night. All in all a good stay. I would recommend only to those who are more interested in economics than other concerns.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Yvonnechick
Reviews.Content: Feb 20,2011. We walked over from another hotel and we got great service as soon as we walked in! Told half of our horrible story about That other hotel and we were accommodated nicely :) Def a better choice and it will be my first choice if I am ever back in Montreal

Reviews.Title: “To be expected”
Reviews.Author: ElleTraveler21
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel on their first major snowstorm of the season. The signs said there was a valet parking service, but the staff was missing! Finally, we found the right person to valet our car into the garage underneath the hotel. The hotel is a bit outdated. The lobby was fair enough, although they had spotty free wifi. Free breakfast was served in the lobby. It was your typical Holiday Inn hot breakfast. The rooms were a bit outdated, but it was helpful to have a kitchenette complete with a full size fridge and microwave. The beds were great and the rooms were clean (we had a suite). The location is excellent! We were able to walk to Old Montreal, Chinatown, Latin Quarter and many museums. The price and location make this spot a noble choice!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected, a pleasant HI hotel with oversized suites.”
Reviews.Author: stigs17
Reviews.Content: Pros: All rooms are large suites set up as one-bedroom apartments with a separate bedroom, easily 50% larger than a standard HI offering. Rooms are well-equipped with a full-sized fridge, microwave, clean dishes, two tube TVs and a large work desk area with a comfortable chair. Super-comfortable bed with nice fresh linens. Spacious, clean bathroom with very good shower pressure and hot water came within 15 seconds. Two large closets. Rooms in back of the hotel are quiet, as you won't hear a thing from the street. Courteous staff. Enjoyable breakfast. Right on the doorstep to Chinatown. One can open the sliding doors for fresh air. Cons: I heard the plumbing of adjoining rooms loud and clear. Tub was clogged, with ankle-high water within seconds, which was brought to their attention. Odd V-shaped tub is uncomfortable to stand in. No restaurant (other than breakfast). Some of the decor needs to be updated to be brought in line with the rest of the room (e.g. the artwork). At night, this is a sketchy area, especially in the summer. Overall, a pleasant stay and a good value for your money in downtown Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money but bring an extra blanket”
Reviews.Author: honkinggoose
Reviews.Content: Had a queen suite for one night at 109 + tax. This appeared to be a one bedroom apartment, with a full size kitchen, small living area and decent sized bedroom. The room was clean; the staff was friendly and helpful. The only downside that I found was the heating unit was either woefully undersized, or was limited in some way. I suspect that the A/C would be the same in the summer. Fortunately there was an extra blanket in the closet, but we could certainly have used another one. It was also pretty tough getting up in the morning in a chilly room.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: Shriner81
Reviews.Content: Some confusion directig us to hotel,Holiday Inn Select is close by and we were directed there first.Once we arrived found the front desk staff polite and friendly.The conceire was always available and knowlegable,The buffet was outstanding and coffee available all day.Only negative was the last night wake up call at 3am when it was supposed to be at 5am. Taxi driver hasseled us for more at the airport and won due to time constraints,so check before you leave hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a Return Stay”
Reviews.Author: Muay_Thai_Mama
Reviews.Content: We were generally pleased with our overnight stay. Our 1-bedroom suite was roomy and clean. Our only complaint with the housekeeping was that we are both very allergic to dust and the sofa needed a good vacuuming. The kitchen and bathroom were both spotless, and the kitchen appliances and bathroom fixtures all looked new and worked fine. The hallway outside our room looked a little dingy and dated, but the decor in our room was fine and we had a very quiet room. The parking valet was prompt, pleasant, and very helpful. Customer vehicles are parked in an outdoor public lot so we were warned not to leave anything valuable visible in our car. Our only complaint regarding service was that continental breakfast is served from 7 am on Saturdays and we needed to eat an hour earlier before our departure. The front desk evening staff mistakenly advised us that they would prepare a breakfast for us and deliver it to our rooms the night before. When nothing arrived none of the staff advised us as to whether we would get any breakfast until the next morning. However, the front desk morning person promptly had the kitchen staff put out the breakfast items (everything except the eggs and bacon) an hour earlier just to accommodate us, so we were able to leave on time. Among the breakfast items, I would say the cinnamon buns are rather good. Since we were just staying overnight and not sightseeing, the best part of the location for us was its easy access to Hwy 720.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good overall experience”
Reviews.Author: philosIsleofMan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. Had a one bedroom suite. Very clean throughout (including corridors where carpets seemed new). Great to have separate lounge and scope for cooking (although we did not use). Comfortable bed and good bathroom. Very quiet. Very good breakfast offered and coffee available most of the day. Picked up outside the door for tours. Chinatown just 2 minutes walk and metro options within 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Seelike
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in great central location close to major attractions and transportation is within walking distance as is Montreal's China Town. You will enjoy the full breakfast and comfortable rooms at this hotel. Came for a music festival in July.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: diazuc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is listed in some search engines as "free parking". There is no free parking. Parking fee with taxes $20 Per day. The staff was very pleasant and informative. The breakfast was self service but enough to leave the children satisfied: cereal, toast, eggs, sausage, cinnamon rolls, yogurts, juice and coffee. Location, location, location... we ate lunch in chinatown which is abour 2 blocks away from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RetiredTraveler_10
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful and courteous. Room was large and clean. Location was great. Easy walk to Old Montreal and Chinatown. Reasonably priced. The staff were especially helpful recommending restaurants and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for the location”
Reviews.Author: DorashCalgary
Reviews.Content: I spent 1 week here whilst attending a conference in the convention centre. The kitchenette provided a big saving, and the price was excellent given the close proximity. This hotel feels like it needs a makeover - maybe it has just been bought into the Holiday Inn Chain. The bathroom was old, and beds lacked support. The design is 'different' with 2 separate rooms and a sofa in one room. Would likely suit families really well. On the whole, excellent value for a long stay, especially given the provided breakfast in the morning...

Reviews.Title: “Large room - unpleasant location”
Reviews.Author: lena080
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok and the room was even better than I expected. The room was clean and very large, and worth of its price! Also the hotel staff was very nice. Breakfast, however, was a little disappointment to me (as European), but maybe it was just normal American style breakfast. But the negative thing was, that for a young woman traveling alone the location of the hotel was not very pleasant. It was not nice experience at all to walk to the hotel from the center or from the metro station in the evening (after 19 or so), since you had to first pass some very suspicious streets full of drunks, drug-users and prostitutes and then continue towards the hotel through empty Rene Levesque street, where the drunks were following you and shouting something. It was not scary at all to walk in the real centre of Montreal, even in the nigth time, but in this district it really was.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: busybusygal
Reviews.Content: Hotel is excellent - Location and amenities... The valet when we arrived was extremely helpful. I was allowed to park my car there (at $18 per day) before checking in as we arrived early. Room was excellent - very clean. The evening valet was not as friendly or helpful, was more interested in talking with a guest than helping anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Frequented by pick-up hookers!!”
Reviews.Author: NakaNiko
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at this hotel on a quick trip to Montreal. Our first impression was quite a positive one as we were greeted by friendly staff. However, that's where it stopped. The room was dirty (hair on the beds), and smelled funny. It seemed that either the water was quite rusty in was sitting there for a bit in the toilet or that someone used it and didn't flush. During the day the hotel seems to be in a not too shabby location, however, at night we realized that it is in the "red light" district of Montreal. There were prostitutes walking in front of the hotel grounds and the staff didn't seem to mind at all. When we were going up to our room, there were two other guys with what were obvious in-call ladies. I wouldn't recommend this hotel. Not clean, at night you realize that's not a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Wanitall
Reviews.Content: The Good: Location. You are within a walking distance from everything - riverfront, Jaques Cartier Square, restaurants, etc. The Not So Good. Our suite was really small. I am not your typical American wanting everything super-sized. I am all for taking less space, consuming less, only what one needs... Well, I NEED a chair in my bedroom so that I could put my clothes on it when I go to bed. I don't think there was even room in the bedroom for a chair or anything really. And the living room was so small that once we unfolded the sofa-bed, we had to climb over it to get to the other side. For nearly $200 per night?! The Bad. We arrived at about 7:30 in the evening and were told that there were no more spaces left in the garage, therefore we should go and try finding a meter to park on. Right! A meter in central Montreal on a Saturday evening! When we came back empty handed after cruising around for a while and asked what we should do, we were told in no uncertain terms that there was nothing the hotel staff could do for us. And the lady that told us that sounded as if we asked for something unreasonable, like, I don't know, a second room, for free. She suggested we try to find a parking lot that would take us. We found one two and a half blocks away under a mural dedicated to fighting heroin addiction (those it was meant for were present right there too). It costed us $25 and we were lucky an overnight space had just opened up, or else we'd have to move the car in a middle of the night. The Bottom Line. The location alone is not worth it. Montreal is not a big city and public transportation is great. If you are close to a metro station, you are close to everything. And it's not like this part of town was pretty or even nice.

Reviews.Title: “No frills-hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Karen2Fold
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights while attending a conference in Montreal. I had requested an early check-in because my flight arrived before their 3pm regular check-in. I was told I would be accommodated as best as possible. When I arrived, however, the staff told me my room wasn't ready. I asked if there were any other rooms available but they said they could only deal with the one originally assigned to me. I was able to leave my bags with the hotel valet and go shopping/sightseeing until check-in. When I returned to the hotel for check-in, the staff told me that the hotel was over-sold and my room was not available. I had already paid for my room in full over the internet, though, so they gave me a substitute room. I would hate to think what would have happened if I hadn't paid in full prior to traveling! The only room they had left was a 2-room suite with a kitchen and living room. So I had this huge suite all to myself for 3 nights. There is no restaurant at the hotel so no room service. They do offer breakfast in the morning just inside the lobby and it included more selections than I expected. Other than the mix-up in the beginning, my stay at the Holiday Inn Express Montreal was quite pleasant. The room was clean, quiet and comfortable. The location is fairly central to universities, the metro, old Montreal and shopping. There is a grocery store (IGA) and liquor store (SAQ) a few blocks away in Complexe Dejardains. Chinatown is also very close. I also want to add that the valets I dealt with at the hotel were very accommodating and friendly. When I left, one valet even phoned ahead for a taxi for me and made sure my driver knew the best route to the airport as to avoid traffic/construction.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again!!”
Reviews.Author: Kunaldg
Reviews.Content: Just minutes from Old Montreal, the USP of this hotel is location. Furthermore, the nearest subway station, the bus station and the train station are within walking distance!! It is also steps away from China Town, which we liked, given our preference for Chinese food. The hotel staff were extremely helpful. The room was huge, with almost a complete kitchen (except the stove).

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Dusty-NJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Memorial Day weekend. It was clean; staff were very accommodating and helpful; location is close to Old Montreal. Good breakfast - hot and cold buffet. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded my expectation”
Reviews.Author: lea28
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during our long Memorial day weekend. One of the best hotel I stayed in. The people there from the front desk to the valets folks were exceptionally friendly and made us feel very welcome. Our room was simple and very clean. Appreciated that they had and iron and blowdryer in the rooms. 2 things I hate packing on trips. Loved the complimentary breakfast they offered. They offered hot meals,cereals,fruits, yogurt ,coffee, tea etc. We had scrambled eggs and sausage and yummy warm cinnabons We stayed on the 7th fl and loved watching the city life from the giant windows. Locations were walking distance to many places like Chinatown and the shopping districts.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Hotel for a no frills one night stay”
Reviews.Author: Sami0602
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Montreal for a days visit, but had to stay overnight. Hotwire found me this not so cheap hotel for 2 adults and just wanting a place to stay the night, I took the deal. a. No frills, but the rooms have a small kitchenette with full size fridge and microwave and a sink. b. There is wired Internet and a work table. The TV cabinet is placed at an odd angle but gives you the appearance of a separation. c. small but sufficient wardrobe. d. clean washroom with a wonderful shower. Complimentary toothbrushes and razors. e. helpful staff and offered to let us park the car outside for a little longer f. REMEMBER parking your car cost $18 extra over the rate. g. Breakfast in included in the price, bread and bagels, scrambled eggs, bacon, various coffee types, teas, cornflakes, jam and marmalade, honey and butter, oatmeal, fruit, yogurt, all complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price but a little shabby compared to other HIE hotels”
Reviews.Author: cdntravel_lovr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night as a last minute getaway and it was just ok. I've stayed at quite a few other Holiday Inn Express hotels in the past, most are newer properties with great ameneties at a very good price. This one however is showing some wear and the beds were not that comfortable. On the upside though it is very well located, clean, the staff was pleasant and the rates are low. The included hot/cold breakfast is also good for the price you pay for the room. We got a very good deal through Hotwire which I'm guessing happens often with this hotel. The guests were a mix of budget travellers - families, tourists, college kids, etc.

Reviews.Title: “felt like in Paris. (freegin yankee)”
Reviews.Author: BonniesBarb
Reviews.Content: Check in. Valet parking. $18 a day and need to tip when car is fetched for you. (of course) so figure $25 a day for parking. Asked for bellman, there are 2 valets for the cars and not busy but they say we don't have bell service. OK Do you have a bellmans cart? yes over there. OK Cart, when you lift it over the threshold into the room, comes apart. I tightened a couple screws , If i had a pliers I would have fixed the cart correctly. Hey Mr. manager??? takes you 2 minutes. The room was average and the breakfast, Included, was average... catered i think. They can't wait to lock it up at the prescribed time (to the second) The area-neighborhood is iffy with some seedy people around .

Reviews.Title: “Convenient.”
Reviews.Author: carria
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express back in 2009. I love it. The room was clean, comfortable and the food was good. It was close to grocery store and a huge mall. The day staff was friendly and helpful. One thing, the night staff could not find my reservation, and finally did. He was not so kind. But, changed his attitude when I said maybe I should have booked elsewhere. I arrived way too early, but he gave me the room anyway. There was also laundry machines and dryer, very convenient. The bed was comfortable and quiet. The food was great. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel except most of the valet staff are rude”
Reviews.Author: TorontoLai
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs renovating. The room ceiling is cracked and the paint works are deteriorating. But this is not a big issue. People don't live here. Other than that, the room is very spacious and clean. Beds are comfortable. The free hotel breakfast is just wonderful. The front desk staff are very friendly and helpful. But most of the valet staff are with miserable long faces and I saw one even yelling at a hotel guest at the hotel entrance. If they can improve their attitude, then this hotel should be graded as perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Worst weekend ever”
Reviews.Author: maid11
Reviews.Content: This was the worst vacation ever.Valet smashed our vechile and just said I dident do it so hotel manager said sorry why would he lie?Well he was the only one driving it to there underground parking as we were not even allowed to go with them to park our vechile.So not only did we pay for a room and valet parking $18.00 a day but had to come home and pay to get it fixed.Just shamefull.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service, and cleaniness”
Reviews.Author: avi8rjosh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the HI Express Centre-Ville for 5 nights with friends. Upon checking in, I found the room to be very clean and a great size for the price. Our room was a single bedroom suite converted to a hotel room. The main room had a small kitchenette with full-size fridge, microwave, and breakfast bar with 3 stools. Also in this room were the two beds and a TV armoire with drawers. The other room which has a door featured another TV armoir, a work desk, and pull-out sofa. The two beds were supposed to be queen size but they felt only a bit larger than a double bed. Also, only internet access available in the rooms is wired. This is a disappointment since only one person in the room can use the connection at once and you are tied to the work desk. I would expect wireless internet at this property for sure. The view from our room was not that great as we faced in the interior of the building. We were not bothered by this however since there is not really much to see directly outside the hotel other than a street and a few other hotels/buildings. We did however like the fact that the windows opened since the room did get a bit warm sometimes. Each morning a complimentary continental breakfast is available. The usual staff like cereal, bread, bagels, yogurt, fruit, etc are provided as well as 2 hot dishes. During the 5 days we were at the hotel, the only hot dishes were bacon/scrambled eggs or a disgusting cheese "omelet"/sausage patties. The best part in my opinion was the cinnamon rolls which were GREAT. Warm and very soft. My friend and myself intended to use the on-site gym but were very disappointed to find only a few mismatched dumbbells, an old treadmill and stairclimber, and a deflated exercise ball. The quality of the gym was quite poor for a HI Express. There was a bag of trash in the gym that was not removed for 3 days. Where is no pool on-site. The business centre has two computers, a printer, and a scanner. I couldn't get the printer to work for some reason. Luckily I had my own computer because the business centre was extremely warm when I went in at night. Overall, the hotel was very much worth the rate of $122 a night due to the cleanliness, size of the rooms, and the location. A 5 minute walk to China-Town and 15 minutes to Plais-de-Congres is a big plus. I would really like to see wireless internet access here though and perhaps an updated gym.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful, a great little spot.”
Reviews.Author: garthicus
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via hotwire.com. We checked the reviews here and all seemed in order. We arrived at the hotel, had a really friendly staff member check us in in record time and off to the room we went. We had a really large one bedroom suite with a full kitchen, spacious bathroom, living room with couch etc and tv, the bedroom was large with a tv too. The place was clean and pleasant, a little worn around the edges but still in great shape. Much to our surprise we learned that breakfast was included, it's a buffet with eggs, sausage/bacon, fruit, yoghurt, cereals, coffee, waffles etc. also there are complimentary newspapers and wifi too..... after the breakfast buffet closes the coffee station is open all day. Also - there is free internet in the rooms via a cable (vs wifi) From start to finish we had a really great stay and would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: MaiYYZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express for 2 nights between Christmas and New Year. Reservations we re made online without any problems. Upon arrival, check in was very quick and we got a bigger room than expected. Our friends paid the same price and got smaller rooms. We got 1 bedroom with separated room, kitchenette, big bathroom, 2 tvs, even dishwasher machine... We paid only $108 per night (2 adults and 2 kids), so was a VERY good deal. Breakfast was included and was OK, but could be better. On the down side, no swimming pool and the valet parking ($18 per day), or you park yourself somewhere else... Anyway, if you looking for good price, good location, thisn is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location, but... DON'T STAY NEW YEARS EVE!!!”
Reviews.Author: tampa47
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Holiday Inn Express / Candlewood Suites Montreal several times over the last few years and found it to be a nice property with a good location and a friendly, helpful, courteous staff. But DO NOT make the mistake we did last December. On New Years Eve, HUNDREDS of college kids and high school kids checked in and ran riot throughout the hotel. They set off the fire alarm SIX TIMES starting at 1am. The hotel management did NOTHING about it. The drunken kids ran through the hallways laughing and screaming, slamming doors and stomping up and down the stairwells to visit their friends on other floors. This went on ALL NIGHT LONG. There were fights in the hallways and, the next morning, there was trash scattered throughout the hotel. Other than that, we had a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Danger of Hotwire route + flexible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jim Beverley
Reviews.Content: My friend and I got a great rate on Hotwire but learned the limits of that option. We got a room for two but the hotel gave my friend one bed at check-in. When I called the hotel to get a room with two beds, we were initially told that it would be $30 more a night. After brief discussion the front desk kindly agreed to waive that charge and we agreed to pay a one-time fee of $30 for the room change. I am grateful to the hotel for this flexibility. This is the kind of generous move that makes me ready to go back again. I will write more later about other hotel details. Jim Beverley

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised”
Reviews.Author: cmarcel78
Reviews.Content: Location- within walking distance to many places (Notre Dame and other bascilicas, Chinatown, Old Montreal, Latin Quarter) Room- A whole lot larger than we expected. It really was previously apartments, so the main bedroom can be an office with a pull out bed/converted couch w/ a tv and free internet access, and the main living room space is where the main bed(s) are. The kitchenette was very convenient. We didn't feel like we were in a hotel room, more like an apartment which was comforting and spacious. Breakfast- Comes with the room rate. Cereal bar, (ok) coffee, juices, several types of breads, oatmeal, yogurt, eggs, pre-made omelletes, sausage, and bacon. Better than a continental breakfast and can hold you over till lunch. This Holiday Inn Express, not the Sofitel. Parking- We came in through train from Quebec City, so didn't need any parking Staff- Most of the people at the reservations desk were in their 20's, younger than expected. But they were accomodating and got the job done. All in all the hotel was clean, well kept, breakfast was expected, the room def. felt like we got value for our money. We spent 3 nts. in Oct at $101/nt.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: BJFToronto
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed for the Thanksgiving/Columbus Day long weekend and was very pleased with this hotel... Great location just a few minutes walk from the Old Port and St. Catherines Street. There is an $18.00 per day parking fee but that includes valet and in/out priveleges so it's very convenient and not unreasonable for downtown parking. The rooms were large and perfect for a family. As well as the standard bedroom portion there is also a kitchenette (full size fridge, microwave, sink, but no stove) with a counter and a couple of stools. Plus there's a second bedroom (!) with pull-out sofa and 2nd TV. Breakfast is included but it's hit & miss. The cold portion includes cereals, yogurt, various breads & spreads, juice machine, coffee and a bowl of bananas. Perfectly adequate. The hot portion is sort of gross and includes egss & meat, changed each day. The scrambled eggs tasted strange, perhaps powdered, so I didn't try.the fold-over omelettes the next day. Bacon was very thin and greasy so I didn't try the pork patties the next day either. All served buffet style with disposable plates, cups & cutlery. Unfortunately no pool. Room rate averaged out to around $110 per night which is very reasonable when you consider the location, size of room and breakfast for the four of us. If I return to Montreal I think I'd scout out a hotel with a pool first. But unless it was around the same price, I'd came back to the Holiday Inn again. I'd rather spend my money on the excellent restaurants in Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but no frills.”
Reviews.Author: melliepont
Reviews.Content: We only had one day to stay in Montreal after our cruise with Holland America. We stayed here due to the proximity to Chinatown, Notre Dame Catherdral, and Rue St. Pierre. The room was decent (two queen beds), and we were fortunate to get early check in (arrived around 10 and the room was still being cleaned up, but the maid was nice enough to let us drop off our stuff). Chinatown is relatively small compared to other metro cities, but they have some pretty good bakeries. The T-stop (subway) is right across the street, so really handy to get to the RESO (underground mall). And Notre Dame and Rue St. Pierre is a five minute walk. If you're looking for a clean, decent room, this will suffice. It wasn't fancy or luxurious, but for our purposes, it was fine. We took the Gray Line tour recommended by the concierge, and it was worth it (they picked & dropped off to our hotel). The price for the room was decent, too. Free internet was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: koslo
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel. It was clean, they gave us a nice big suite and the breakfast was good. Valet parking is ~$19 (Can.) and there isn't really a good multi day public parking nearby. Hotel location is excellent if you want to visit the old part of the city and chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room and Service”
Reviews.Author: SanBos
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and I must say it was a good exprience. The staff was very helpful and curtious. The room had a an attached kitchen and a study with Wired internet connectivity. The location is perfect for those who would like to visit the old montreal city as it very much walkable from the hotel. Only if they dont charge the fee for parking.

Reviews.Title: “It was a beautiful, clean and friendly hotel with large rooms.”
Reviews.Author: meks87
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful inside and the rooms were spacious. Our room had a fully size refrigerator and sink, and a queen size bed. The sheets were extremely soft and the pillows were firm. I really would recommend this hotel. You will need to pay for parking and that costs $18. This hotel is only blocks away from near Vieux-Port and is within reasonable walking distance to Rue-St. Catherine (about 2 blocks) where you have your chain restaurants and clothing stores, the underground city (with lots of stores to shop) and the train station, Saint Laurent. The supermarket is 1 block away. You can also walk to Musee de Chateau Ramezay, Marche Bonsecurs, Place Jacques Cartier, Basilique de Notre Dame Montreal, and take a cruise along the St. Lawrence River. (We used La Ba Bateau Mouche.) You can take the train to Champ de Mars to visit these sites, but if you stay at the hotel you can walk a few blocks. (like 5 blocks) This hotel is in an excellent location as it in downtown Montreal. This hotel may also come up in your search as Holiday Inn Express Montreal Centre-ville Downtown, is located at 155 Rene-Levesque East, Montreal, Quebec H2X3Z8. The hotel has free internet. It has a great FREE breakfast (eggs, cheese, sausage, cereal, bacon, yogurt, toast etc.)

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Ottawa_traveller77
